text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's store
podcast.com
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 89 in today's
episode I have a new word for you a
verse let's find out what it means and
how you can use it in your daily
conversation a verse sometimes you may
feel very uncomfortable or uneasy when
you deal with certain people or things
the word averse basically means to have
a strong disliking or in opposition
towards someone or something when you
try to avoid a situation that you wish
not to be in or you avoid a person
because of his behavior it means you are
averse to such a situation or a person
you are actually reluctant and unwilling
to deal with something as it may be very
unpleasant for example people who are
vegetarian can't stand the sight of raw
meat as they dislike it so they are
averse to it the word of verse is an
adjective as it describes a person's
feeling of dislike towards something the
word aversive lis is an adverb as it
shows the action of disliking someone or
something the word aversion is used as a
noun
always remember the verse can never be
used as a verb okay now that you know
what a verse means let's take a look at
some example sentences to see how you
can use it in your daily conversation
example 1 after an ugly argument
Samantha and Peter looked at each other
with mistrust and aversion
example two at the Chinese restaurant
Jennifer told the chef I'm not averse to
broccoli if it's cooked right example
three due to her failure of high school
Sheila has lost all hope and is now
averse to hard work as she feels it's
pointless example four with her nasty
attitude Kelly was not averse to
criticizing and picking up fights with
everyone around her example five as
catherine has a deep aversion to waking
up early in the morning she has taken up
the second shift at work example 6
Michelle found her boyfriend's mother
very stern in their first meeting and
has developed an instant aversion
towards her example 7 after the
big-budget film flopped the popular
director kept a very low profile and was
averse to media attention and interviews
example 8
the parents were averse to the idea of
sending their son for an overnight
picnic as they felt he was too young for
such an experience
example nine Charles usually dislikes
drinking but is not averse to an
occasional beer when he is with his
friends example 10 with the downfall in
share markets the investors are now
averse to investing more money example
11 marina is not a confident person
she has an inferior complex and is
averse to facing people she avoids going
out that's the end of today's episode
are you averse to someone or something
and why kindly share your experiences in
the comment box below this video thank
you for watching us do watch all the
episodes of daily video vocabulary to
better your English language skills do
subscribe to our Channel and stay
updated with all the latest lessons I
will see you again tomorrow with a new
word or a phrase till then bye and take
care
